Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: The SCANsat zoom map allows for focusing on a specific area, showing greater detail. It uses an orthographic (spherical) map projection to minimize distortion near its center.

Text.Name: Target Text
Text.Text: Shows contract and custom waypoints. Create new waypoints with the button. *

Text.Name: Readout
Text.Text: Information about the area under the current mouse position.

Text.Name: Vessel Sync
Text.Text: Sync the map to the current vessel location.

Text.Name: Vessel Lock
Text.Text: Lock the map to the current vessel location.

Text.Name: Window State
Text.Text: Toggle between three different window sizes.

Text.Name: Resize
Text.Text: Drag this handle to resize the map.

Text.Name: MechJeb note/Note Text
Text.Text: When MechJeb is installed the waypoint button can be used to set the landing guidance site.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: Generate high-resolution visual maps and anomaly data.

Text.Name: Worldview/Abi Text
Text.Text: Generate low-resolution visual and resource maps, and biome data.

Text.Name: KH11/Msi Text
Text.Text: Generate low-resolution visual and resource maps, and biome data.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: SCANsat includes support for IVA panel displays when using Raster Prop Monitor. *

Text.Name: RPM note/Note Text
Text.Text: Raster Prop Monitor by Mihara and MOARdV.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: Want to supplement stock resource scanning, enhance it, or go beyond it? SCANsat has you covered.

Text.Name: Mise/Abi Text
Text.Text: Generate low-resolution visual and resource maps, and biome data.

Text.Name: Hyperion/Msi Text
Text.Text: Generate low-resolution visual and resource maps, and biome data.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: SCANsat features a number of tools that can help to discover resource deposits and pinpoint the ideal location for your mining facility.

Text.Name: Map Text
Text.Text: The SCANsat big map features a resource selection button and a resource overlay toggle; mouse over the map to display the resource concentration at any location. Use these functions to find the best deposits.

Text.Name: Instruments Text
Text.Text: Use the instrument data window to see resource concentrations at your vessel’s current location.

Text.Name: Zoom Text
Text.Text: Use the zoom map for the most accurate data and to pinpoint a landing target.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: Adjust the resource scanning options to your likings. *

Text.Name: MM note/Note Text
Text.Text: Module Manager is required for SCANsat resource scanning.

Text.Name: Instant Scan/Instant Scan Text
Text.Text: Update all SCANsat resource databases when a stock resource scan is completed. Only visible when Stock Scanning is enabled.

Text.Name: Biome Lock/Biome Lock Text
Text.Text: Bypass the requirement for ground-truthing surface scans.

Text.Name: Disable Stock/Disable Stock Text
Text.Text: Completely disable all stock resource scanning functions; SCANsat features replacements for these.

Text.Name: Narrow Band/Narrow Band Text
Text.Text: Full resource abundance accuracy requires a Narrow-Band Scanner to be in an orbit that passes over a given area.

Text.Name: Stock Threshold/Stock Threshold Text
Text.Text: Upon reaching the specified threshold of scanning with the M700 scanner, a stock resource scan will be performed (no science is awarded for this scan).

Text.Name: Overlay Tooltips/Overlay Tooltips Text
Text.Text: Tooltips when the mouse is over the planet in map view.

Text.Name: Resource Interpolation/Resource Interpolation Text
Text.Text: Adjust the level of interpolation for resource maps; affects map accuracy.

Text.Name: Resource Height/Resource Height Text
Text.Text: Adjust the size of the resource map; affects quality and accuracy.

Text.Name: Biome Height/Biome Height Text
Text.Text: Adjust the size of the biome map.

Text.Name: Coverage Transparency/Coverage Transparency Text
Text.Text: Adjust the transparency of the resource map for areas below the cutoff threshold.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: SCANsat provides a complete planetary overlay system. It can be used to display resource deposits, and standard SCANsat terrain and biome data.

Text.Name: Overlay Window
Text.Text: Use the Overlay Control window to select the different map overlays.

Text.Name: Tooltips
Text.Text: Tooltips provide information about the location under the mouse cursor while an overlay is active.

Text.Name: Resource Settings
Text.Text: Open resource scanning and overlay options settings page.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: Generate low-resolution visual and resource maps, and biome data.

Text.Name: Abi/Abi Text
Text.Text: Generate low-resolution visual and resource maps, and biome data.

Text.Name: Msi/Msi Text
Text.Text: Generate low-resolution visual and resource maps, and biome data.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: The SCANsat main map provides an overview of scanning operations for the current celestial body. It also serves as a gateway to all of the other SCANsat windows.

Text.Name: Type
Text.Text: Toggle between altimetry and biome maps.

Text.Name: Minimize
Text.Text: Minimize the vessel info section at the bottom.

Text.Name: Map
Text.Text: The map continuously updates and shows the current position of all active SCANsat vessels.

Text.Name: Windows Buttons
Text.Text: Open and close different SCANsat windows.

Text.Name: Current Vessel
Text.Text: Shows information about the current vessel, even if it does not have a SCANsat sensor.

Text.Name: Vessel Button
Text.Text: Double click on any vessel to switch to that vessel.

Text.Name: Vessel Info
Text.Text: Shows information about all vessels with active SCANsat sensors orbiting the current celestial body.

Text.Name: Scanning Percentage
Text.Text: The scanning completion percentage for all active sensors onboard the vessel.

Text.Name: Scanning Status
Text.Text: Scanning status indicators for different sensor types.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: What are some of the things we can do with SCANsat?

Text.Name: More/Much_More
Text.Text: Scan for resources, locate ideal landing areas, collect science, track contract waypoints, export map images, discover mysterious anomalies, and more.

Text.Name: Scanners/Parts
Text.Text: SCANsat provides several intruments; these are used to map out a planet or moon's surface terrain, biomes, resources, and visual surface.

Text.Name: Build_Maps/Maps
Text.Text: Maps can be generated using data from SCANsat instruments; all of which can be collected while the scanning vessels are unloaded.

Text.Name: Localization/Translations
Text.Text: SCANsat supports locization for most of its text with translations by: Deltathiago98 - Spanish Ser and RarogCmex - Russian Summerfirefly - Chinese h0yer - German Orlando - Portuguese don-vip - French

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: SCANsat includes many features related to mapping, navigation, and more.

Text.Name: Study Anomalies/Anomalies Text
Text.Text: Gather detailed information about anomalies with the BTDT scanner after scanning with a high-resolution visual scanner or other orbital anomaly scanner.

Text.Name: Anomaly Icon
Text.Text: Anomaly position is indicated by the circle of the question mark.

Text.Name: Icons
Text.Text: Toggle anomaly, surface feature, waypoint, and flag icons.

Text.Name: Info
Text.Text: Instruments window data readouts; these are dependent on scanning coverage.

Text.Name: Resource Buttons
Text.Text: Toggle between different resources if more than one is installed.

Text.Name: Anomaly Info
Text.Text: Anomaly and Breaking Ground Surface features window and information.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: Choose from various terrain color palettes and adjust numerous settings for each celestial body.

Text.Name: Color Palettes/Color Palettes Text
Text.Text: Choose from a number of different terrain color palettes; use the drop-down menu to switch between four palette types.

Text.Name: Terrain Settings/Terrain Settings Text
Text.Text: Adjust the minimum and maximum terrain altitude values; these are used to set the end points for the chosen color palette. Most values with a slider can be adjusted using the text input field on the left.

Text.Name: Clamp Terrain/Clamp Terrain Text
Text.Text: The Clamp Terrain value is used to separate the chosen palette into two regions; below this altitude only the first two colors of the palette will be used. This is particularly useful on ocean planets.

Text.Name: Palette Options/Palette Options Text
Text.Text: Further modify the selected color palette using the various options available.

Text.Name: Config Save/Config Save Text
Text.Text: From this page, or the resource color page, use the Save Values To Config button to store all selections in a separate file located in the SCANsat/Resources folder. These values will be used as defaults and for any new save files.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: Adjust slope colors and cutoff values to your likings.

Text.Name: Slope Color/Slope Color Text
Text.Text: SCANsat slope maps use two pairs of colors to display terrain slope. One pair for areas with relatively low slope angles, and another for high slope angles. *

Text.Name: Slope Cuttoff/Slope Cuttoff Text
Text.Text: Adjust the slope cutoff value to alter the slope level where SCANsat switches between the two color pairs; this is particularly useful when using the zoom map.

Text.Name: Slope color pair note/Note Text
Text.Text: It is generally best to choose the same color for the middle two color values.

Text.Name: Slope Zoom Caption
Text.Text: Demonstrating the difference between a slope cutoff value of 1 on top, and 0.3 on the bottom.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: Adjust resource color and cutoff values for each planetary resource.

Text.Name: Resource Color/Resource Color Text
Text.Text: SCANsat resource maps use two colors to represent each resource; varying resource concentrations interpolate between these two colors.

Text.Name: Cutoffs/Cutoffs Text
Text.Text: Resources with concentrations below the Min Cutoff will not be displayed; anything above the Max Cutoff will be displayed using the High Color.

Text.Name: Transparency/Transparency Text
Text.Text: Change the transparency value to adjust how much of the underlying SCANsat map is visible below the resource overlay.

Text.Name: Apply/Apply Text
Text.Text: Resource cutoff values are saved separately for each celestial body. Apply values to only the current selection or to all celestial bodies.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: Adjust biome color values or switch to using stock biome map colors.

Text.Name: Color Picker/Color Picker Text
Text.Text: Use the HSV color picker on this and other pages to select a new color. Switch between Low and High color selection using the toggle buttons along the bottom. Adjust the hue using the slider along the right. The new selection will be shown above the existing color. RGB color can be manually selected using the text input fields on the left; both 0-1 and 0-255 ranges can be used.

Text.Name: Biome Options/Biome Options Text
Text.Text: Switch to using the bright stock biome map colors, toggle the white border between biomes and adjust the level of transparency for the terrain shading drawn below the biome map.

Text.Name: Biome Colors/Biome Colors Text
Text.Text: SCANsat biome maps assign each biome a color by interpolating between two color end-points. Adjust these end-points using the color picker to generate different color biome maps.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: SCANsat allows for numerous adjustments to the colors used for all of the included map types; all controlled through the Color Management Page of the Settings Window.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: The SCANsat big map shows celestial bodies in greater detail, offers multiple different map types, can be re-sized, and features several map overlays along with other functions.

Text.Name: Readout
Text.Text: Information about the area under the current mouse position.

Text.Name: Window Buttons
Text.Text: Open and close different SCANsat windows.

Text.Name: Map Export
Text.Text: Export the current map to the SCANsat/PluginData folder.

Text.Name: Resize
Text.Text: Drag this handle to resize the map.

Text.Name: MechJeb note/Note Text
Text.Text: When MechJeb is installed the waypoint button can be used to set the landing guidance site.

Text.Name: Header/SubHead
Text.Text: How to start scanning, find the right orbit, and build maps.

Text.Name: Indicators/Indicator_sub
Text.Text: There are numerous indicators available for monitoring scanning activity, these include:

Text.Name: Indicators/Context
Text.Text: Right-Click context menus show the current status.

Text.Name: Indicators/Ground Tracks
Text.Text: Map view ground track indicators show the area currently being scanned only when the scanner is within the acceptable altitude range (dependent on settings).

Text.Name: Indicators/VAB Info
Text.Text: VAB/SPH extra info panels show the scanning parameters for each instrument.

Text.Name: Indicators/Maps
Text.Text: The flashing lights on the small map indicate scanner status (green for ideal altitude, flashing orange for below the ideal altitude, solid orange for too high or too low).

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: Generate low and high resolution altimetry data and slope maps.

Text.Name: Header/Header_Question
Text.Text: How to optimize your orbit for the fastest scan.

Text.Name: Orbit Overlay Header/Orbit text
Text.Text: The big map's orbit overlay provides useful data for determining the best scanning orbit.

Text.Name: Bad orbit
Text.Text: Bunched up equatorial crossings indicate a poor orbit.

Text.Name: Bad orbit/Bad To Good
Text.Text: Often only a minor burn (<10m/s dV) is required to change a bad orbit into a good orbit, with evenly spaced equatorial crossings.

Text.Name: Big Map caption
Text.Text: The orbit overlay* shows your previous (orange) and next (blue) orbit; the hash marks along the equator show where the vessel will cross the equator over the next 100 orbits.
